transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Hello, is this James? This is Nicole Harper calling from Premier Financial.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: James, I'm reaching out about your account that has a balance of $2,650. I see you've missed the last two payments. Can you tell me what's going on?

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: My car broke down and I had to use my bill money to fix it. I need it for work.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I understand unexpected expenses can really throw off your budget. Here's what I can do - if you can make a payment of $300 today, I can push your next payment out by two weeks to give you some breathing room.

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: I don't have $300 today. Could I do $150?

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Hmm, that's a bit low, but let me see what I can work out. If you commit to $150 today and then $200 in two weeks, I think I can make that work. Sound fair?

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: Yes, I can do that. Thank you for working with me.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: No problem, James. I know things happen. Just make sure you hit those dates, okay? I'm noting this in your account so you won't get any calls during that time.
